SEARCH
Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.ldap.client

Interface BindResultHandler

public interface BindResultHandler
Handler for bind operation results.

This handler receives the result of a bind operation, which authenticates the client to the LDAP server.

On success, the handler receives an LDAPSession interface for performing directory operations. On failure, the handler receives the error result and an LDAPConnected interface to retry with different credentials or close the connection.

Author:
Chris Burdess
See Also:
  • LDAPConnected.bind(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, org.bluezoo.gumdrop.ldap.client.BindResultHandler)
  • LDAPSession

  • Method Details

    • handleBindSuccess

      void handleBindSuccess(LDAPSession session)
      Called when bind succeeds.

      The connection is now authenticated and can perform directory operations using the provided session interface.

      Parameters:
      session - operations available in the authenticated session

    • handleBindFailure

      void handleBindFailure(LDAPResult result, LDAPConnected connection)
      Called when bind fails.

      Common failure reasons include:

      • INVALID_CREDENTIALS - wrong password
      • NO_SUCH_OBJECT - DN does not exist
      • INAPPROPRIATE_AUTHENTICATION - method not allowed

      The handler can retry with different credentials using the provided connection interface, or close the connection.

      Parameters:
      result - the failure result with error code and message
      connection - operations to retry or close
